intro: Bowringia mildbraedii, commonly known as the mildbraed's bowringia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentagonal leaves that are often tinged with red or purple. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Bowringia mildbraedii is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats and is adapted to the cool, high-altitude environments of its native range.
